text: Oxygyne is a genus of plant in family Burmanniaceae, first described as a genus in 1906. It has a highly disjunct distribution, found in Japan in East Asia and in Cameroon in Central Africa.Govaerts, R., Wilkin, P. & Saunders, R.M.K. (2007). World Checklist of Dioscoreales. Yams and their allies: 1-65. The Board of Trustees of the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew. ==Species== * Oxygyne hyodoi C.Abe & Akasawa \- Ehime on Shikoku Island in Japan * Oxygyne shinzatoi (Hatus.) C.Abe & Akasawa \- Nansei-shoto (Ryukyu Islands) in Japan * Oxygyne triandra Schltr. \- Cameroon * Oxygyne yamashitae Yahara & Tsukaya \- Yaku- shima in Japan ==References== Category:Dioscoreales genera Category:Burmanniaceae Category:Parasitic plants Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Oxygyne
